UnitType.Backstory:
Sprites are diminutive forest dwelling creatures that can be found in Mushroom Groves. They are known to some as forest mites, however they are in fact not related to Mites and other than a similar outward appearance they have nothing in common.
Sprites are reclusive creatures and difficult to negotiate with. They avoid both men and fallen where possible - preferring the company of woodland creatures. Although physically very weak, they tend to be found in large groups and have several magical abilities including strong spell resistance that can make them frustrating to deal with when encountered.

Sprites are diminutive forest dwelling creatures that can be found in Mushroom Groves. They are known to some as forest mites, however they are in fact not related to Mites and other than a similar outward appearance they have nothing in common.
Sprites are reclusive creatures and difficult to negotiate with. They avoid both men and fallen where possible - preferring the company of woodland creatures. Although physically very weak, they tend to be found in large groups and have several magical abilities including strong spell resistance that can make them frustrating to deal with when encountered.
These giant wasps are extremely fast and have a toxic piercing attack. They will usually avoid contact with anything larger than themselves, however if provoked, they are highly agressive.

UnitType.Quote: You would do well to leave me be.
UnitType.Backstory: In the time before this one - before the coming of the Titans, before the Cataclysm that sundered the world - lesser Elementals such as these served as attendants to Elemental Lords, those who men worshipped as the Five of Anthuane. These creatures were called Anathua for this reason; they were thought to be the physical manifestation of the magic of the shards, which they were never far from. That time has passed. The Lesser Elementals know no allegiance now; they are as likely as not to attack without warning.
The Hyleoroi or "watcher of the woods" is a female nature spirit that serves to protect the forests and it's inhabitants.

Though the Titans brought death magic to this world, it was the Empress Ceresa who mastered it. She used these energies to corrupt and transform the minor Elementals of this world, twisting their powers to suit her own needs.
According to Ezmir, Cyndrum was the most heavily guarded of all entrances to N'it'Vaganesh - the laboratory of the damned, where first Curgen and then Morrigan the Mad made monsters from the creatures of Elemental. These demons are said to have been fashioned by Ceresa using the arcane tools she found in Cyndrum's ruins. For every soldier they kill, demons summoned in this manner are able to add another of their own kind to their forces.
The Nightwing is often called to the material world by dark wizards and other masters of the black arts, frequently used for guarding treasure or support during combat.
The Nightwing is often called to the material world by dark wizards and other masters of the black arts, frequently used for guarding treasure or support during combat.
Reclusive, defensive, brutally powerful, this monster is extremely territorial and violently aggressive. The Cave Hoarder is an intelligent creature possessing mind bending spell like powers.

These are the domesticated cousins of those wolves that haunt the wild north. First tamed by the tribes of the Nimer, these animals are loyal to a fault, and quite dangerous to anyone who threatens their master.

GameItemType.Description: This is a powerful weapon that can shoot clear through a body and into the person behind him.

GameModifier.Provides: Power Shot- Strike through 3 units in a line

GameItemType.Description: A full suit of stone armor.

GameItemTypeModel.ModelFile: gfx/hkb/items/armor/kingdom armor/kingdom heavy armor export A/kingdom_heavy_helmet_A.hkb

UnitType.Backstory: Stone guardians are found protecting tombs and treasures.

GameItemType.Description: A soldier's cloak is a symbol of commitment by the strong and proud of the realm.
A deadly weapon for hunting or war.

GameModifier.Provides: Impale- Strike an opponent and whoever is behind them

UnitType.Backstory: A mighty champion from a long forgotten time.

GameModifier.Provides: Bash- Has a chance equal to the damage done of knocking the victim prone
Crushing Blow- +100% Attack, but you lose your next action
Backswing- If the attack misses the unit gets a second attack against the same target

UnitType.Description: There are few creatures on Elemental that are able to withstand more damage than a War Golem. Long have they stood silent, patient sentry over their charges.
UnitType.Backstory: These are creatures forged of mana and metal; beings who can be summoned into existence only by those possessing the blood of the Aivernach - the Iron Tribes of old. An Iron Golem can wield any weapon given to it, and is a master of defense; long after the last men of Aivern fell to the hordes of Meergas Maz Adul's Nerazga, its Iron Golems remained, stalwart protectors of the city walls.

In Erwynn's Tales, wolves are often found as companions of men. As far back as the Age of the Magi, there are stories of wolf packs accompanying the great armies of men to war. Now though, in the aftermath of the cataclysm, their natural prey has become scarce, and these creatures must be regarded as dangerous by all who encounter them.
Wolf pelts remain rare enough that merchants are still willing to pay a fair price for them.

Wild Boars are still relatively common in Elemental even post cataclysm. They seemingly possessing a knack for survival through difficult conditions, surely helped by their willingness to eat pretty much anything... or anyone.

Most Hergon are herd animals, males and females grouping together. In some case however, overly aggressive young males are displaced from the herd by the older males. These Rogue Hergon usually end up as Troll food in short time, however in some cases a particularly large and intelligent Rogue will thrive on it's own. These Hergon can outlive their herd dwelling counterparts, growing to much larger sizes and developing an aggressive nature that makes them a terrifying but fortunately rare encounter.

Sages say the Ophidian were once great pythons, related to the bonefield morelia, but they were changed after generations of nesting near crystal deposits. Those crystals became embedded in their scales. The Ophidian are now over twice as long as their ancestors, and immune to spells. Their bite causes a feeling of numbness and euphoria in the victim; a sensation that helps numb the horror of being swallowed whole.
Those brave enough to capture or kill Ophidian can make a great deal of money selling their scales to enchanters and their venom to those of less repute.
